title: How long does it take to complete a splash?
body: i remember the old art splashs that were posted on youtube, i believe the syndra splash took 8-9 hours (im prolly wrong) but the new splashes are infinitly more detailed and complex. im curious how long it takes them now.

replies.body:
It takes about 1-2 months depending on iteration and feedback. This is from the VERY Beginning to the end, not just the rendering though. So this includes doing a bunch of quick thumbnails till we get the approved pose/scene. That in of itself can take awhile until we settle on the actual image we want to render out.

That time also takes into account that the splash artist has various meetings through out the day and might be helping other splash artists out with paint overs and feedback as well, so its not like 8 hours a day for 1-2 months straight.
Weird, seems like it's been more than 1-2 momths since the Nidalee rework and you guys said Pharaoh Nid would get a modern splash.  I guess one of us just lost track of the time
We are reworking 5 Nidalee Splashes, so it takes longer then 1-2 months. Things like Taric Rework splashes also come in and take priority as well. We are also doing the Trist & Trundle ones as well.

do you guys have plans to do even more splashes that aren't part of updating a reworked champion? for example, while you've finally gotten almost every outdated base splash now, Leona and a few others still stick out a bit for having very plain posing etc. 

the new eve rammus warwick etc splashes are really  great btw!

Glad you like the new splashes!

We currently don't have a Leona one in the works, sorry. But anything is possible in the future!
Please keep Leona's splash art as it is. It's still great.
